name: IOANNIS SAVVAIDIS
title: Computer Engineer and Composer
profile: Computer Engineer and Composer dedicated to building sustainable systems and exploring the intersection of technology and art. Experienced in managing large-scale production infrastructures with a focus on observability and performance while cultivating a culture of respect and collaboration.
artistBio: Composer drawing on Quantum and Distributed Computing principles to interpret relativistic reality. Discography with record labels including Anopolis, June, Lower Parts, and Phormix. Performs live with synthesizers under an improvisational approach.
engineerBio: Computer Engineer specializing in Systems and Site Reliability Engineering, with 10+ years managing large-scale AWS cloud, on-prem vSphere, and Kubernetes environments. Proven track record of improving systems performance, cutting costs, and advancing observability. Experienced in critical production operations and incident response, with deep debugging and automation skills. Strong collaborator shaping infrastructure long-term strategy, and SRE culture at a staff level. Currently, pursuing a Master's in Quantum Computing.
artisticApproach: Drawing from a Computer Engineering background, emerged into music, experimenting with the concept of 'Tensor Music'. An approach that explores vector spaces and their interactions, shaping multidimensional spaces. Currently focused on apparent Superluminal Motion and Quantum nonlocality.

collaborations.title: "SACRED TALES/COVID-19" by Aemilia Papaphilippou (Athens Epidaurus Festival, 2021), Short Composition
"Stone Age" by Joshua Olsthoorn (Film, 2022), Film Scoring

description: Architected a production‐grade GKE platform with Terragrunt, Argo CD, WAF, Trivy, and a self- managed Kubernetes and Observability stack; full env spin up in < 30 min.
Built a Kubernetes‐native REST API (Go & Vue.js), OpenTelemetry instrumented, with security and efficiency scanning; re-usable CI/CD in GitHub Actions and GitOps managed.
Developed a modular repository management tool for hermetic builds, integrating with GitHub Actions and Argo CD, enhancing CI/CD workflows.
Completed MSc coursework, deepening knowledge in Computer Engineering and Physics.
Researching a Go‐based quantum‐workload Orchestrator for distributed QPUs; prototyping scheduler and observability model as part of MSc thesis.
Owned uptime for 6  EKS &  RDS clusters as sole SRE, leading RCAs for critical incidents, implementing permanent fixes that reduced recurrence by 80%.
Created a four‐quarter roadmap that set SRE strategy (culture, SLOs, scaling) and reduced 50% of toil.

Consolidated 300+ self-managed AWS ASGs into 5 multi-AZ groups, raising Kubernetes utilisation from 20 % to  70 %, trimming EC2 cost by  30 %, and handling unpredictable GPU/CPU bursts (+50 pods/sec).
Automated zero-downtime EKS upgrades 1.21 to 1.26 with blue/green pools and canary workloads.
Cut alert noise 80% by deploying actionable alerts and mentoring 2 engineers; MTTR improved by 40 %.
Led TileDB Cloud to microservices migration, introducing API Gateway, Helm helpers, and Pyroscope.
Refactored Terraform IaC in SOC 2 compliant infrastructure, improving maintainability and scalability.
Built the company’s first observability stack using LGTM, providing USE/RED Grafana dashboards.
Developed Python exporters to instrument core systems and introduced production-grade alerting.
Advocated SRE culture: introduced incident response and SLI/SLO workshops to leadership.
Managed 6-region AWS infrastructure (Kubernetes, RDS, ElastiCache, Kafka & ElasticSearch clusters).
Introduced Thanos, Tempo, and Loki with SLO-based observability; unified monitoring in Grafana, tracking thousands RPS, and supporting 250+ internal users.
Established GitOps workflows: infrastructure with Terragrunt via Atlantis, deployments with Argo CD, and CI/CD with GitHub Actions and self-hosted runners.
Centralised Docker images & Helm charts into Harbor OCI registry, slashing pull latency 40 %, and enabling security, proxy-cache, and RBAC.
Built a Go API to sandbox 70+ Kubernetes-native microservices, enabling 200+ engineers to ship faster.
Provisioned AWS SSO with OneLogin for 200+ engineers, improving access control and auditing.
Deployed incident.io to formalize incident response and authored observability documentation.
Oversaw VMware vSphere infrastructure across 3 DCs: 300 bare-metal servers, 5K VMs, 10 SAN arrays; provisioned ESXi hosts with VLAN tagging, LUN mapping, and zoning.
Automated VM provision and cut internal SLA time from 3 days to 3 hours; standardized VM lifecycle and governance, streamlining workflows and coordination across PMs, Networks, DevOps teams.
Managed BIND Authoritative DNS with 300+ zones and Linux (CentOS/RHEL) VM Images.
Owned L3 on-call and VMware escalations; implemented actionable Nagios alerting.
Migrated public traffic from Apache to NGINX reverse proxy farms, boosting security and performance.
Deployed self-managed Kubernetes clusters and Jenkins CI pipelines; containerized in-house products.
Designed campus IaaS with GRNET’s Synnefo stack on 3 bare-metal servers + SAN; delivered VM self‐service portal for professors and researchers.
